info.title: Mailchimp Marketing Automation
info.description: Mailchimp helps small businesses do big things, with the right tools and guidance every step of the way.

get.description: Get a summary of an account's Automations.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: before_create_time
parameters.description: Restrict the response to automations created before this time. Uses the ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: since_create_time
parameters.description: Restrict the response to automations created after this time. Uses the ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: before_start_time
parameters.description: Restrict the response to automations started before this time. Uses the ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: since_start_time
parameters.description: Restrict the response to automations started after this time. Uses the ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Restrict the results to automations with the specified status.

schema.description: An array of objects, each representing an Automation workflow.

items.title: Automation Workflow
items.description: A summary of an individual Automation workflow's settings and content.

id.title: Automation Campaign ID
id.description: A string that identifies the Automation.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the Automation was created in ISO 8601 format.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time the Automation was started in ISO 8601 format.

status.title: Automation Status
status.description: The current status of the Automation.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for the Automation.

list_is_active.title: List Status
list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

segment_opts.title: Segment Options
segment_opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options.

saved_segment_id.title: Saved Segment ID
saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a specific campaign(s).

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: Either the web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with an Automation workflow.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to the automation workflow. One of the following: has started the workflow, has completed the workflow, has not started the workflow, or has not completed the workflow.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id for the automation workflow to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members have/have not interacted with a specific poll in a Mailchimp email.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the poll.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a campaign via 'Converstaions'.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of a member's interaction with a conversation. One of the following: has replied or has not replied.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: The type of date field to segment on: The opt-in time for a signup, the date the subscriber was last updated, or the date of their last ecomm purchase.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: When the event took place:  Before, after, is a specific date, is not a specific date, is blank, or is not blank.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.

extra.title: Segment Extra Value
extra.description: When segmenting on 'date' or 'campaign', the date for the segment formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or the web id for the campaign.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a specific campaign(s).

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The name of the email client.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's language.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's language is or is not set to a specific language.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: A two-letter language identifier.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by member rating.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have have a rating that is/not exactly a given number or members who have a rating greater/less than a given number.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The star rating number to segment against.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's signup source was/was not a particular value.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The signup source.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a survey monkey survey.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to the survey.One of the following: has started the survey, has completed the survey, has not started the survey, or has not completed the survey.

value.title: Survey ID
value.description: The unique ID of the survey monkey survey.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's VIP status.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member is or is not marked as VIP.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based on interest group information. This should start with 'interests-' followed by the grouping id. Ex. 'interests-123'.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member is a part of one, all, or none of the groups.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: An array containing strings, each representing a group id.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not purchased specific items or categories.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: A member who has purchased from a category/specific item that is/is not a specific name, where the category/item name contains/doesn't contain a specific phrase or string, or a category/item name that starts/ends with a string.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The ecommerce category/item information.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members have an average spent total, a total number of orders, total number of products purchased, or average number of products per order.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than the segment value.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than this amount.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members who have/have not purchased anything.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have have ('member') or have not ('notmember') purchased.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members who have spent a specific amount on a single order or over their lifetime.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have spent 'more' or 'less' than then specified value.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The total amount a member spent.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members have purchased from a specific store.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have or have not purchased from a specific store.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The store id to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's Goal activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the website URL is/not exactly, contains/doesn't contain, starts with/ends with a string.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The URL to check Goal activity against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's last interaction with a website.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the website activity happened after, before, or at a given timestamp.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The date to check Goal activity against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/are not apart of a 'similar subscribers' segment.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the 'similar subscribers' segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/are not apart of a static segment.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the static segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are within a specific country or US state.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The two-letter country code or US state abbreviation.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are within a specific geographic region.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The radius of the target location.

addr.title: Segment Location Address
addr.description: The address of the target location.

lat.title: Segment Location Latitude
lat.description: The latitude of the target location.

lng.title: Segment Location Longitude
lng.description: The longitude of the target location.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are within a specific US zip code.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The radius of the target location.

extra.title: Extra Data
extra.description: The zip code to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members for which locaiton information is unknown.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are/are not within a specific US zip code.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The 5-digit zip code.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based age ranges in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The age range to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on listed gender in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The Social Profiles gender to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on influence rating in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have a rating that is/not or greater/less than the rating provided.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The Social Profiles influence rating to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on social network in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not on a given social network.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The social network to segment against.

oneOf.title: Social Profiles Social Network Follow Segment

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on social network in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not following a linked account on a given social network.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The social network to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: An address-type merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's address merge field contains/does not contain a value or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to segment a text merge field with.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: An address or zip-type merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's address merge field is within a given distance from a city or zip.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The distance from the city/zip.

extra.title: Segment Extra
extra.description: The city or the zip being used to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A date merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's birthday merge information is/is not a certain date or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: A date to segment against (mm/dd).

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A date merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's merge information is/is not, is greater/less than a value or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: A date to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's merge information is/is not a value or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to segment a text merge field with.

oneOf.title: Text or Number Merge Field Segment

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A text or number merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's merge information is/is not, contains/does not contain, starts/ends with, or is greater/less than a value

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to segment a text or number merge field with.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's email address.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the email address is/not exactly, contains/doesn't contain, starts/ends with a string.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to compare the email against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on predicted gender.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The predicted gender to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on predicted age

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The predicted age to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have subscribed within a given time frame.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whe the event took place, namely within a time frame.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.

settings.title: Automation Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for the Automation workflow.

title.title: Automation Title
title.description: The title of the Automation.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name for the Automation (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the Automation.

use_conversation.title: Conversations
use_conversation.description: Whether to use Mailchimp's [Conversations](https://mailchimp.com/help/set-up-and-use-conversations/) feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The Automation's custom 'To' name, typically the first name [merge field](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-merge-tags/).

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Whether to automatically append Mailchimp's [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the Automation.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Whether to automatically inline the CSS included with the Automation content.

tracking.title: Automation Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for the Automation.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Tracking
salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for an Automation. Must be using Mailchimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-mailchimp-for-salesforce/).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email address.

capsule.title: Capsule CRM Tracking
capsule.description: Capsule tracking options for an Automation. Must be using Mailchimp's built-in [Capsule integration](https://connect.mailchimp.com/integrations/capsule-crm-integration?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email addresses.

workflow_title.title: Workflow Title
workflow_title.description: The title of the workflow type.

runtime.title: Automation Workflow Runtime Settings
runtime.description: A workflow's runtime settings for an Automation.

days.title: Days
days.description: The days an Automation workflow can send.

hours.title: Hours
hours.description: The hours an Automation workflow can send.

type.title: Email Send Time Settings
type.description: When to send the Automation email.

workflow_emails_count.title: Workflow Emails Count
workflow_emails_count.description: The number of emails in the Automation workflow.

report_summary.title: Campaign Report Summary
report_summary.description: A summary of opens and clicks for sent campaigns.

opens.title: Automation Opens
opens.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

clicks.title: Total Clicks
clicks.description: The total number of clicks for an campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks, divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

automations.title: Automation Workflows
automations.description: An array of objects, each representing an Automation workflow.

total_items.title: Item Count
total_items.description: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination.

settings.title: Automation Campaign Settings

use_conversation.description: Whether to use Mailchimp's [Conversations](https://mailchimp.com/help/set-up-and-use-conversations/) feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The Automation's custom 'To' name, typically the first name [merge field](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-merge-tags/).

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Whether to automatically append Mailchimp's [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the Automation.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Whether to automatically inline the CSS included with the Automation content.

tracking.title: Automation Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for the Automation.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

id.title: Automation Campaign ID
id.description: A string that identifies the Automation.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the Automation was created in ISO 8601 format.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time the Automation was started in ISO 8601 format.

status.title: Automation Status
status.description: The current status of the Automation.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for the Automation.

list_is_active.title: List Status
list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

segment_opts.title: Segment Options
segment_opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options.

saved_segment_id.title: Saved Segment ID
saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a specific campaign(s).

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: Either the web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with an Automation workflow.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to the automation workflow. One of the following: has started the workflow, has completed the workflow, has not started the workflow, or has not completed the workflow.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id for the automation workflow to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members have/have not interacted with a specific poll in a Mailchimp email.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the poll.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a campaign via 'Converstaions'.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of a member's interaction with a conversation. One of the following: has replied or has not replied.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: The type of date field to segment on: The opt-in time for a signup, the date the subscriber was last updated, or the date of their last ecomm purchase.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: When the event took place:  Before, after, is a specific date, is not a specific date, is blank, or is not blank.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.

extra.title: Segment Extra Value
extra.description: When segmenting on 'date' or 'campaign', the date for the segment formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or the web id for the campaign.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a specific campaign(s).

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The name of the email client.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's language.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's language is or is not set to a specific language.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: A two-letter language identifier.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by member rating.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have have a rating that is/not exactly a given number or members who have a rating greater/less than a given number.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The star rating number to segment against.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's signup source was/was not a particular value.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The signup source.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a survey monkey survey.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to the survey.One of the following: has started the survey, has completed the survey, has not started the survey, or has not completed the survey.

value.title: Survey ID
value.description: The unique ID of the survey monkey survey.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's VIP status.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member is or is not marked as VIP.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based on interest group information. This should start with 'interests-' followed by the grouping id. Ex. 'interests-123'.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member is a part of one, all, or none of the groups.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: An array containing strings, each representing a group id.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not purchased specific items or categories.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: A member who has purchased from a category/specific item that is/is not a specific name, where the category/item name contains/doesn't contain a specific phrase or string, or a category/item name that starts/ends with a string.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The ecommerce category/item information.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members have an average spent total, a total number of orders, total number of products purchased, or average number of products per order.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than the segment value.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than this amount.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members who have/have not purchased anything.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have have ('member') or have not ('notmember') purchased.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members who have spent a specific amount on a single order or over their lifetime.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have spent 'more' or 'less' than then specified value.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The total amount a member spent.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members have purchased from a specific store.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have or have not purchased from a specific store.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The store id to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's Goal activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the website URL is/not exactly, contains/doesn't contain, starts with/ends with a string.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The URL to check Goal activity against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's last interaction with a website.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the website activity happened after, before, or at a given timestamp.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The date to check Goal activity against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/are not apart of a 'similar subscribers' segment.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the 'similar subscribers' segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/are not apart of a static segment.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the static segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are within a specific country or US state.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The two-letter country code or US state abbreviation.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are within a specific geographic region.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The radius of the target location.

addr.title: Segment Location Address
addr.description: The address of the target location.

lat.title: Segment Location Latitude
lat.description: The latitude of the target location.

lng.title: Segment Location Longitude
lng.description: The longitude of the target location.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are within a specific US zip code.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The radius of the target location.

extra.title: Extra Data
extra.description: The zip code to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members for which locaiton information is unknown.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting subscribers who are within a specific location.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Segment members who are/are not within a specific US zip code.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The 5-digit zip code.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based age ranges in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The age range to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on listed gender in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The Social Profiles gender to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on influence rating in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have a rating that is/not or greater/less than the rating provided.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The Social Profiles influence rating to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on social network in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not on a given social network.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The social network to segment against.

oneOf.title: Social Profiles Social Network Follow Segment

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on social network in Social Profiles data.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not following a linked account on a given social network.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The social network to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: An address-type merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's address merge field contains/does not contain a value or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to segment a text merge field with.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: An address or zip-type merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's address merge field is within a given distance from a city or zip.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The distance from the city/zip.

extra.title: Segment Extra
extra.description: The city or the zip being used to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A date merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's birthday merge information is/is not a certain date or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: A date to segment against (mm/dd).

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A date merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's merge information is/is not, is greater/less than a value or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: A date to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's merge information is/is not a value or is/is not blank.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to segment a text merge field with.

oneOf.title: Text or Number Merge Field Segment

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: A text or number merge field to segment.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's merge information is/is not, contains/does not contain, starts/ends with, or is greater/less than a value

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to segment a text or number merge field with.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's email address.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the email address is/not exactly, contains/doesn't contain, starts/ends with a string.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The value to compare the email against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on predicted gender.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The predicted gender to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members based on predicted age

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/not the exact criteria listed.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The predicted age to segment.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have subscribed within a given time frame.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whe the event took place, namely within a time frame.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.

settings.title: Automation Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for the Automation workflow.

title.title: Automation Title
title.description: The title of the Automation.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name for the Automation (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the Automation.

use_conversation.title: Conversations
use_conversation.description: Whether to use Mailchimp's [Conversations](https://mailchimp.com/help/set-up-and-use-conversations/) feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The Automation's custom 'To' name, typically the first name [merge field](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-merge-tags/).

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Whether to automatically append Mailchimp's [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the Automation.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Whether to automatically inline the CSS included with the Automation content.

tracking.title: Automation Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for the Automation.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Tracking
salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for an Automation. Must be using Mailchimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-mailchimp-for-salesforce/).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email address.

capsule.title: Capsule CRM Tracking
capsule.description: Capsule tracking options for an Automation. Must be using Mailchimp's built-in [Capsule integration](https://connect.mailchimp.com/integrations/capsule-crm-integration?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email addresses.

workflow_title.title: Workflow Title
workflow_title.description: The title of the workflow type.

runtime.title: Automation Workflow Runtime Settings
runtime.description: A workflow's runtime settings for an Automation.

days.title: Days
days.description: The days an Automation workflow can send.

hours.title: Hours
hours.description: The hours an Automation workflow can send.

type.title: Email Send Time Settings
type.description: When to send the Automation email.

workflow_emails_count.title: Workflow Emails Count
workflow_emails_count.description: The number of emails in the Automation workflow.

report_summary.title: Campaign Report Summary
report_summary.description: A summary of opens and clicks for sent campaigns.

opens.title: Automation Opens
opens.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

clicks.title: Total Clicks
clicks.description: The total number of clicks for an campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks, divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

settings.title: Automation Campaign Settings

title.description: The title of the Automation.

from_name.description: The 'from' name for the Automation (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the Automation.

use_conversation.title: Conversations
use_conversation.description: Whether to use Mailchimp's [Conversations](https://mailchimp.com/help/set-up-and-use-conversations/) feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The Automation's custom 'To' name, typically the first name [merge field](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-merge-tags/).

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Whether to automatically append Mailchimp's [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the Automation.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Whether to automatically inline the CSS included with the Automation content.

tracking.title: Automation Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for the Automation.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for an Automation. Must be using Mailchimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-mailchimp-for-salesforce/).

campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

schema.title: Automation Emails
schema.description: A summary of the emails in an Automation workflow.

items.title: Automation Workflow Email
items.description: A summary of an individual Automation workflow email.

id.title: Automation Email ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the Automation email.

web_id.title: Automation Web ID
web_id.description: The ID used in the Mailchimp web application. View this automation in your Mailchimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/campaigns/show/?id={web_id}`.

workflow_id.title: Workflow ID
workflow_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies an Automation workflow.

position.title: Email Position
position.description: The position of an Automation email in a workflow.

delay.title: Automation Delay
delay.description: The delay settings for an Automation email.

amount.title: Delay Amount
amount.description: The delay amount for an Automation email.

type.title: Delay Type
type.description: The type of delay for an Automation email.

direction.title: Delay Direction
direction.description: Whether the delay settings describe before or after the delay action of an Automation email.

action.title: Delay Action
action.description: The action that triggers the delay of an Automation email.

action_description.title: Delay Action Description
action_description.description: The user-friendly description of the action that triggers an Automation email.
action_description.example: subscribers purchase anything from your store

full_description.title: Full Delay Description
full_description.description: The user-friendly description of the delay and trigger action settings for an Automation email.
full_description.example: 1 day after subscribers purchase anything from your store

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time the campaign was started in ISO 8601 format.

archive_url.title: Archive URL
archive_url.description: The link to the campaign's archive version in ISO 8601 format.

status.title: Campaign Status
status.description: The current status of the campaign.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent in ISO 8601 format

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

needs_block_refresh.title: Needs Block Refresh
needs_block_refresh.description: Determines if the automation email needs its blocks refreshed by opening the web-based campaign editor.

has_logo_merge_tag.title: Has Logo Merge Tag
has_logo_merge_tag.description: Determines if the campaign contains the *|BRAND:LOGO|* merge tag.

list_is_active.title: List Status
list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

segment_text.title: Segment Text
segment_text.description: A description of the [segment](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-groups/) used for the campaign. Formatted as a string marked up with HTML.

recipient_count.title: Recipient Count
recipient_count.description: Count of the recipients on the associated list. Formatted as an integer.

segment_opts.title: Segment Options
segment_opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options. This object should contain a `saved_segment_id` to use an existing segment, or you can create a new segment by including both `match` and `conditions` options.

saved_segment_id.title: Saved Segment ID
saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

prebuilt_segment_id.title: Prebuilt Segment Id
prebuilt_segment_id.description: The prebuilt segment id, if a prebuilt segment has been designated for this campaign.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a specific campaign(s).

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: Either the web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with an Automation workflow.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to the automation workflow. One of the following: has started the workflow, has completed the workflow, has not started the workflow, or has not completed the workflow.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id for the automation workflow to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members have/have not interacted with a specific poll in a Mailchimp email.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the poll.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a campaign via 'Converstaions'.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of a member's interaction with a conversation. One of the following: has replied or has not replied.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: The type of date field to segment on: The opt-in time for a signup, the date the subscriber was last updated, or the date of their last ecomm purchase.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: When the event took place:  Before, after, is a specific date, is not a specific date, is blank, or is not blank.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.

extra.title: Segment Extra Value
extra.description: When segmenting on 'date' or 'campaign', the date for the segment formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or the web id for the campaign.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a specific campaign(s).

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The name of the email client.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Segmenting based off of a subscriber's language.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's language is or is not set to a specific language.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: A two-letter language identifier.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by member rating.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have have a rating that is/not exactly a given number or members who have a rating greater/less than a given number.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The star rating number to segment against.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member's signup source was/was not a particular value.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The signup source.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a survey monkey survey.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to the survey.One of the following: has started the survey, has completed the survey, has not started the survey, or has not completed the survey.

value.title: Survey ID
value.description: The unique ID of the survey monkey survey.

field.title: Segment Field

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the member is or is not marked as VIP.

op.description: Whether the member is a part of one, all, or none of the groups.

field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not purchased specific items or categories.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: A member who has purchased from a category/specific item that is/is not a specific name, where the category/item name contains/doesn't contain a specific phrase or string, or a category/item name that starts/ends with a string.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The ecommerce category/item information.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members have an average spent total, a total number of orders, total number of products purchased, or average number of products per order.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than the segment value.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than this amount.

field.description: Used for segmenting members who have/have not purchased anything.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have have ('member') or have not ('notmember') purchased.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting members who have spent a specific amount on a single order or over their lifetime.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who have spent 'more' or 'less' than then specified value.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The total amount a member spent.

field.title: Segment Field

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Whether the website activity happened after, before, or at a given timestamp.

value.title: Segment Value
value.description: The date to check Goal activity against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members who are/are not apart of a 'similar subscribers' segment.

value.title: Segment Operator

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the Automation email.

web_id.description: The ID used in the Mailchimp web application. View this automation in your Mailchimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/campaigns/show/?id={web_id}`.

workflow_id.title: Workflow ID
workflow_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies an Automation workflow.

position.title: Email Position
position.description: The position of an Automation email in a workflow.

delay.title: Automation Delay
delay.description: The delay settings for an Automation email.

amount.title: Delay Amount
amount.description: The delay amount for an Automation email.

type.title: Delay Type
type.description: The type of delay for an Automation email.

direction.title: Delay Direction
direction.description: Whether the delay settings describe before or after the delay action of an Automation email.

action.title: Delay Action
action.description: The action that triggers the delay of an Automation email.

action_description.title: Delay Action Description
action_description.description: The user-friendly description of the action that triggers an Automation email.
action_description.example: subscribers purchase anything from your store

full_description.title: Full Delay Description
full_description.description: The user-friendly description of the delay and trigger action settings for an Automation email.
full_description.example: 1 day after subscribers purchase anything from your store

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time the campaign was started in ISO 8601 format.

archive_url.title: Archive URL
archive_url.description: The link to the campaign's archive version in ISO 8601 format.

status.title: Campaign Status
status.description: The current status of the campaign.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent in ISO 8601 format

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

needs_block_refresh.title: Needs Block Refresh
needs_block_refresh.description: Determines if the automation email needs its blocks refreshed by opening the web-based campaign editor.

has_logo_merge_tag.title: Has Logo Merge Tag
has_logo_merge_tag.description: Determines if the campaign contains the *|BRAND:LOGO|* merge tag.

list_is_active.title: List Status
list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

segment_text.title: Segment Text
segment_text.description: A description of the [segment](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-groups/) used for the campaign. Formatted as a string marked up with HTML.

recipient_count.title: Recipient Count
recipient_count.description: Count of the recipients on the associated list. Formatted as an integer.

segment_opts.title: Segment Options
segment_opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options. This object should contain a `saved_segment_id` to use an existing segment, or you can create a new segment by including both `match` and `conditions` options.

saved_segment_id.title: Saved Segment ID
saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

prebuilt_segment_id.title: Prebuilt Segment Id
prebuilt_segment_id.description: The prebuilt segment id, if a prebuilt segment has been designated for this campaign.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a specific campaign(s).

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to their campaign interaction. One of the following: opened, clicked, was sent, didn't open, didn't click, or was not sent.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: Either the web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with an Automation workflow.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of the member with regard to the automation workflow. One of the following: has started the workflow, has completed the workflow, has not started the workflow, or has not completed the workflow.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id for the automation workflow to segment against.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting by Mandrill activity.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: Members have/have not interacted with a specific poll in a Mailchimp email.

value.title: Segment Operator
value.description: The id for the poll.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: Used for segmenting subscribers who have/have not interacted with a campaign via 'Converstaions'.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The status of a member's interaction with a conversation. One of the following: has replied or has not replied.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: The web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have/have not interacted with any campaigns.

field.title: Segment Field
field.description: The type of date field to segment on: The opt-in time for a signup, the date the subscriber was last updated, or the date of their last ecomm purchase.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: When the event took place:  Before, after, is a specific date, is not a specific date, is blank, or is not blank.

value.title: Segment Data
value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.

extra.title: Segment Extra Value
extra.description: When segmenting on 'date' or 'campaign', the date for the segment formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or the web id for the campaign.

value.title: Segment Data

field.title: Segment Field

op.description: Whether the member's language is or is not set to a specific language.

value.title: Segment Data

settings.title: Campaign Settings
settings.description: Settings for the campaign including the email subject, from name, and from email address.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

title.title: Campaign Title
title.description: The title of the campaign.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append Mailchimp's [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the campaign.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

auto_tweet.title: Auto-Tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-campaign-archives-and-pages/) page when the campaign is sent.

auto_fb_post.title: Auto Post to Facebook
auto_fb_post.description: An array of [Facebook](https://mailchimp.com/help/connect-or-disconnect-the-facebook-integration/) page ids to auto-post to.

fb_comments.title: Facebook Comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The id for the template used in this campaign.

drag_and_drop.title: Drag And Drop Campaign
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the campaign uses the drag-and-drop editor.

tracking.title: Campaign Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for a campaign.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [Click Tale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Tracking
salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for a campaign. Must be using Mailchimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-salesforce-with-mailchimp/).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email address.

capsule.title: Capsule CRM Tracking
capsule.description: Capsule tracking option for a campaign. Must be using Mailchimp's built-in [Capsule integration](https://connect.mailchimp.com/integrations/capsule-crm-integration?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email address.

social_card.title: Campaign Social Card
social_card.description: The preview for the campaign, rendered by social networks like Facebook and Twitter. [Learn more](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-customize-social-cards/).

image_url.title: Image URL
image_url.description: The url for the header image for the card.

description.title: Campaign Description
description.description: A short summary of the campaign to display.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign.

workflow_title.title: Workflow Title
workflow_title.description: The title of the workflow type.

runtime.title: Automation Workflow Runtime Settings
runtime.description: A workflow's runtime settings for an Automation.

days.title: Days
days.description: The days an Automation workflow can send.

hours.title: Hours
hours.description: The hours an Automation workflow can send.

type.title: Email Send Time Settings
type.description: When to send the Automation email.

workflow_emails_count.title: Workflow Emails Count
workflow_emails_count.description: The number of emails in the Automation workflow.

report_summary.title: Campaign Report Summary
report_summary.description: For sent campaigns, a summary of opens and clicks.

opens.title: Automation Opens
opens.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

clicks.title: Total Clicks
clicks.description: The total number of clicks for an campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.
